overall_summary: Primary themes were continued friction and confusion around the AI16Z→ELIZAOS migration (especially exchange-specific handling and Korean community concerns), alongside ongoing core product work (streaming, plugin actions) and process pressure to merge an oversized Discord plugin PR. GitHub signals strong near-term prioritization of UI/UX simplification (terminology cleanups, edit-mode behavior fixes) and platform stability work.

new_issues_prs.title: Fix edit mode chat suggestions triggering agent responses
new_issues_prs.author: borisudovicic
new_issues_prs.significance: Closes an edit-mode UX bug where suggestions could accidentally trigger agent responses.

new_issues_prs.title: Fix avatar mismatch between edit view and sidebar
new_issues_prs.author: borisudovicic
new_issues_prs.significance: Resolves UI consistency issue affecting identity/recognition in the editor vs sidebar.

new_issues_prs.title: Replace "RAG" terminology with plain language
new_issues_prs.author: borisudovicic
new_issues_prs.significance: Confirms a product direction toward less technical terminology to improve accessibility.

new_issues_prs.title: Snapshot Eligibility Issue + Tangem Wallet Connection Not Supported (Discord Support Compromised)
new_issues_prs.author: pereslavlland
new_issues_prs.significance: Ongoing migration eligibility/support gap for non-supported wallets and reports of impersonation risk in support channels.

new_issues_prs.title: Eliza Cloud Integration, add MCP + A2A service starter, integrate CLI and starter projects tight
new_issues_prs.author: lalalune
new_issues_prs.significance: Large Cloud+CLI integration PR intended to streamline create→deploy→publish/monetize flow; appears high-impact but requires careful review.

new_issues_prs.title: feat(auth): implement JWT authentication and user management
new_issues_prs.author: standujar
new_issues_prs.significance: Major step toward multi-tenant/data-isolated deployments via JWT verification strategies and server/socket auth integration.

overall_focus.claim: Daily GitHub activity shows issue-driven iteration (14 new issues opened, no PRs created/merged) with UI/edit-mode fixes and terminology simplification being actively closed out.

Broader December development focus combines backend stabilization (SQL plugin migration/RLS/idempotency tests, server refactors, dependency alignment) with a planned UI/UX overhaul and onboarding simplification (renames, dashboard redesign, guided onboarding).

discord_updates.summary: Conversation was dominated by token migration confusion and frustration (notably Korean community concerns about Bithumb) and discrepancies in how exchanges (e.g., Bithumb vs Kraken) treat snapshot-based distributions; migration on Solana was reiterated as still possible.

Developers discussed extending agent actions in a Starknet plugin context: suggested cloning the plugin into the monorepo packages folder, adding new action files under actions, and registering them via src/index; actions docs were shared as the reference point.

A business/deployment signal emerged: market makers reportedly want agents deployed in production and visibly engaging in social environments before committing further; emphasis was placed on iterating from a live product rather than waiting for perfection.

Core devs noted streaming functionality working for simple messages/actions (PRs in eliza-cloud-v2 and monorepo). A large Discord plugin PR (~66 commits) was deemed ready to merge but risky due to size/age; review was proposed before merging.

user_feedback.feedback_summary: Korean community members expressed strong dissatisfaction with Bithumb’s handling/timing of the token swap and requested evidence of project↔exchange communications regarding snapshot timing.
Users requested clearer, exchange-specific token swap documentation (especially around snapshot eligibility and post-snapshot selling on CEXs).
Developers reported persistent local PostgreSQL migration/setup issues and needed hands-on troubleshooting for permissions/configuration.
Process suggestion: require PR screenshots/videos (especially for UI changes) to reduce review ambiguity and speed merges.
Community asked for more visibility for the 100k ELIZAOS creative contest and clearer pointers to official channels/resources.

strategic_insights.theme: Migration communications are a trust and support scaling bottleneck
strategic_insights.insight: Exchange-specific token swap handling (and perceived late notification disputes) is producing sustained community frustration and repeated support demands; without a single authoritative, exchange-tailored playbook, the narrative is being shaped by confusion and price anxiety.
implications_or_questions: Should the team publish a dedicated per-exchange migration status page (snapshot policy, eligibility edge cases, timelines)?
Is there an internal incident-response protocol for support impersonation/scam attempts that should be publicly documented?

strategic_insights.theme: Large, aging PRs are increasing integration risk
strategic_insights.insight: The Discord plugin PR being open for weeks and growing to dozens of commits increases merge risk and slows downstream distribution; this suggests a need for PR decomposition or stricter merge-SLA/review gates for high-churn plugins.
implications_or_questions: Should maintainers enforce a maximum PR size or require feature-flagged incremental merges for plugins?
Do we need CI/e2e coverage specific to Discord plugin behavior before merging?

strategic_insights.theme: Production deployment is becoming a prerequisite for partnerships/liquidity support
strategic_insights.insight: Partner channel notes indicate market makers want proof of agents operating in production and engaging socially before deeper support; this pushes prioritization toward reliability, deployment tooling, and visible live agent demos over purely architectural improvements.
implications_or_questions: What minimal 'production agent' definition (uptime, engagement metrics, safety) should the team standardize?
Can streaming/UI polish be aligned to a demo-grade cloud experience quickly?

strategic_insights.theme: Product direction favors simplification and onboarding over technical jargon
strategic_insights.insight: Rapid closure of issues like replacing 'RAG' terminology and a broader backlog oriented around dashboards and onboarding suggests deliberate movement toward mainstream usability, which may accelerate adoption but requires consistent documentation alignment.
implications_or_questions: Are docs and UI terminology being updated in lockstep to avoid mismatches (e.g., 'RAG' vs 'Files')?

market_analysis.observation: Kraken listing/distribution event scheduled for Dec 19 at 15:00 UTC, with a stated 1:6 distribution ratio for AI16Z holders based on the Nov 11 snapshot.
market_analysis.relevance: A near-term liquidity and visibility catalyst that may amplify support load and confusion if exchange messaging is inconsistent.

market_analysis.observation: Community discussion reflected concern about ELIZAOS price declines during migration and attributed a 'dump' to retail selling ('jeets'), without additional evidence.
market_analysis.relevance: Market sentiment can worsen support pressure and reputational risk during operational events like migrations.

security_and_risk.claim: A potential security incident was raised around the migration site (claims of compromise/funds stolen), and separate reports flagged impersonators/scammers undermining support channels for migration guidance.
recommended_followups: Publish official, signed/verified migration links and a 'never send tokens manually' warning in prominent channels and docs.
Provide a public post-mortem or status update if an incident occurred; otherwise explicitly confirm findings and mitigation steps.
